intro: Campanula punctata var. punctata, commonly known as the spotted bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often marked with dark purple or brown spots, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
